verses.text: Vision from God that Obadiah got about Edom.
God’s like, “Edom, you think you’re untouchable? I’m about to humble you.”
Even if you chill in the clouds or hide super high, I’ll pull you down.
Mountains, fortresses, high spots—you’re still not safe. Pride’s your downfall.
Your neighbors gonna laugh when trouble hits; your allies won’t back you.
No one’s coming to help. When trouble strikes, you’re solo.
Your violence and schemes? Karma’s real—coming right back at you.
Your own fam turns on you; even your closest peeps won’t save you.
Your city walls? Useless. You’re about to be roasted.
God’s like, “You did dirty to my people. That’s on you.”
Remember sneaking around during your brother’s chaos? That energy is coming back.
Don’t flex while others are hurting. God sees everything.
Cheering on your neighbor’s loss? Big yikes.
The day’s coming when you’ll get served what you dished.
The Lord’s day is coming for everyone; your actions catch up, no cap.
Those who helped you? They get the same energy you threw at others.
God’s people? They get saved and thrive.
Edom’s crew is getting wiped out; Jacob’s squad is shining.
Israel’s exiles return and reclaim their land.
The nations around them get judged; God’s Kingdom rules.
And the Kingdom belongs to God—forever lit, always.
